data.title: So Much for so Little
data.meta_description: Directed by Looney Tunes animation legend Chuck Jones, this 1949 Oscar-winning documentary short, commissioned by the Harry Truman administration, is dishearteningly timely. Unfolding the life story of a baby, it makes the case of public healthcare, praising its contribution to the lowering of infant mortality rates. Seven decades later, this historic documentary attains renewed and grim relevance.
data.text:
So Much for so Little

#body #society

Directed by Looney Tunes animation legend Chuck Jones, this 1949 Oscar-winning documentary short, commissioned by the Harry Truman administration, is dishearteningly timely. Unfolding the life story of a baby, it makes the case of public healthcare, praising its contribution to the lowering of infant mortality rates. Seven decades later, this historic documentary attains renewed and grim relevance.

Screening Schedule

No physical screenings scheduled.

Direction: Chuck Jones

Script: Friz Freleng, Chuck Jones

Music: Carl W. Stalling

Production: Warner Bros

Producers: Edward Selzer

Format: DCP

Color: Color

Production Country: USA

Production Year: 1949

Duration: 10΄

Contact: Warner Bros

Awards/Distinctions: Best Short Documentary – Academy Awards 1950

Chuck Jones

Filmography

1938 The Night Watchman (fiction short)

1942 My Favorite Duck (fiction short)

1949 So Much for so Little (short)

1961 The Mouse on 57th Street (fiction short)

1966 How the Grinch Stole Christmas! (TV movie short) (co-directed)

1970 The Phantom Tollbooth (fiction)

1977 Bugs Bunny in Space (TV movie, co-direction)

1991 Chuck Amuck: The Movie (short, co-direction)

2001 The Chuck Jones Show (TV series)

2018 The Dover Boys Re-Animated (fiction short) (co-direction)
